will adhere to the Code of Ethics, so

621
00:28:54,480 --> 00:28:55,638
you do wanna be familiar with it.

622
00:28:55,638 --> 00:28:58,185
It has a preamble as you could see there,

623
00:28:58,185 --> 00:29:00,975
along with what are called
the Code of Ethics Cannons.

624
00:29:00,975 --> 00:29:05,495
And so you want to be familiar with the
preamble understand that the safety and

625
00:29:05,495 --> 00:29:10,340
welfare of society is really our common
good and we ultimately act therefore.

626
00:29:10,340 --> 00:29:14,360
To not only safeguard that, and
further that, but we strictly adhere to

627
00:29:14,360 --> 00:29:17,620
the Code of Ethics Canons which
are listed below the preamble.

628
00:29:17,620 --> 00:29:20,670
And the most important Code of
Ethic Canon, you can see there

629
00:29:20,670 --> 00:29:24,810
is ultimately to protect society,
the common good, public trust, etc.

630
00:29:24,810 --> 00:29:29,160
But to act honorably, act justly,
act legally, provide diligent and

631
00:29:29,160 --> 00:29:32,970
competent service, and to advance and
protect the profession.

632
00:29:32,970 --> 00:29:34,940
The most important thing,
it's stated there, but

633
00:29:34,940 --> 00:29:38,300
it may not be 100% clear, so
let me just come right out and tell you.

634
00:29:38,300 --> 00:29:43,040
The most important thing with the Code
of Ethics is to ensure life safety.

635
00:29:43,040 --> 00:29:46,690
To make sure that anybody who we
ultimately have in our charge,

636
00:29:46,690 --> 00:29:48,890
as an individual, a coworker whatever,

637
00:29:48,890 --> 00:29:52,910
we always focus on their safety before
we focus on the safety of information.

638
00:29:52,910 --> 00:29:55,980
If it ever comes down to a choice,
we always wanna save people and

639
00:29:55,980 --> 00:29:57,070
not save infrastructure.

640
00:29:57,070 --> 00:29:58,630
I guess, is the right way of putting that.

641
00:29:58,630 --> 00:30:01,815
Code of Ethics is really about making
sure that a security practitioner,

642
00:30:01,815 --> 00:30:04,775
members of the Info Sec Community
that we understand how to act?

643
00:30:04,775 --> 00:30:08,465
And to represent our profession in
such a way that we always bring

644
00:30:08,465 --> 00:30:11,695
a good light to that, and
we always act honorably and ethically, and

645
00:30:11,695 --> 00:30:13,805
don't engage in unethical behavior.

646
00:30:13,805 --> 00:30:17,925
So very important, hopefully that will
help you to be focused as a professional

647
00:30:17,925 --> 00:30:20,205
and really understand
where you need to be, but

648
00:30:20,205 --> 00:30:21,815
do make sure you're familiar
with the Code of Ethics.

649
00:30:21,815 --> 00:30:23,535
Definitely something to look at.

650
00:30:23,535 --> 00:30:26,720
So I think that pretty much wraps up
our discussion in the legal area.

651
00:30:26,720 --> 00:30:27,395
>> Yeah, Absolutely.

652
00:30:27,395 --> 00:30:31,080
And most of you have probably
not gone to Law School.

00:30:31,080 --> 00:30:33,060
In fact, I would imagine
the majority of you haven't.

00:30:33,060 --> 00:30:35,680
So you are not expected to be
an attorney on the exam, but

655
00:30:35,680 --> 00:30:38,340
you do need to have a grasp of these
concepts because they come into play.

656
00:30:38,340 --> 00:30:42,505
When we deal with security we
are dealing with illegal activities,

657
00:30:42,505 --> 00:30:45,219
that's why this job position even exists.

658
00:30:45,219 --> 00:30:46,870
People are doing things illegal.

659
00:30:46,870 --> 00:30:49,360
We need to be able to recognize that,

660
00:30:49,360 --> 00:30:49,980
>> Correct.

00:30:49,980 --> 00:30:52,679
>> I think we're getting pretty thorough

00:30:52,679 --> 00:30:54,170

like if your watching this recorded

A it'll take you right in there,

We wanna make sure you guys

00:31:20,420 --> 00:31:25,260
So if anything's not completely clear,

676
00:31:25,260 --> 00:31:26,690
Well, hope you guys enjoyed the show.

677
00:31:26,690 --> 00:31:29,200
Signing off for ITProTV, I'm Don Pizet.

episodes.description: In this episode Adam and Mike describe the various components of physical security such as mantraps and bollards. They also cover environmental security such as natural disasters. They discuss several ways to implement control to help protect the network from both.
